name: Fault-Tolerant Parallel Processor
author: Enno Ruijters <e.j.j.ruijters@utwente.nl>
description: The fault-tolerant parallel processor (FTPP) consists of four groups of processors, interconnected by one network per group. The model also has 'N' workstations, each with one processor of each group. If more than one processor in a group has failed (or is connected to a failed network element), the workstation fails, which is considered a system failure. Failure times of the processors and network element follow a k-phase Erlang distribution. The model was one of the original examples for the development of repairable fault trees [1], and later extended to include repairs in [0]. The original model was translated by the DFTRES tool [2] using the DFTCalc tool [3].
challenge: Rare event of interest, large model but reduced to small CTMC under weak bisimulation

parameters.name: k
parameters.description: Number phases in the Erlang distribution of failure times

conversion.command: convert.sh FTPP-1-1.dft && java -jar CONVERT.jar --jani FTPP-1-1.exp > FTPP-1-1.jani
convert.sh FTPP-2-1.dft && java -jar CONVERT.jar --jani FTPP-2-1.exp > FTPP-2-1.jani
convert.sh FTPP-3-1.dft && java -jar CONVERT.jar --jani FTPP-3-1.exp > FTPP-3-1.jani
convert.sh FTPP-4-1.dft && java -jar CONVERT.jar --jani FTPP-4-1.exp > FTPP-4-1.jani
convert.sh FTPP-1.dft && java -jar CONVERT.jar --jani FTPP-1.exp > FTPP-1.jani
convert.sh FTPP-2.dft && java -jar CONVERT.jar --jani FTPP-2.exp > FTPP-2.jani
convert.sh FTPP-3.dft && java -jar CONVERT.jar --jani FTPP-3.exp > FTPP-3.jani
convert.sh FTPP-4.dft && java -jar CONVERT.jar --jani FTPP-4.exp > FTPP-4.jani

properties.name: boundedreach
properties.description: Probability that a system failure occurs before time 1.
